maml:description.maml:para: Add role to an user
Add role to an user
Copyright © 2006-2017
Role object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMRole or created via New-RDMRole.
User object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMSecurityGroup or created via New-RDMUser.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Add-RDMRoleToUser -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Add-RDMRoleToUser -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add role to an user.

maml:description.maml:para: Close an opened session.
You will be prompted to confirm the close.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Forces close of the session without confirmation by the user. Optional.
Specifies the ID of the session to be closed.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Close-RDM-Session -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Close-RDM-Session -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions, close the session at index 1.
Force close of the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the list of available data sources.
Retrieve the list of available data sources. The current selected data source is marked with an "X".
Copyright © 2006-2017

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-DataSource -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-DataSource -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available data sources and sets the current data source the the second element in the list.
Retrieves the list of available data sources.
Retrieves the list of available data sources and displays the first item.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the domain from the specified session.
Get the domain from the specified session.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to get the domain from.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Domain -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Domain -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the domain from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Retrieves the list of available sessions and gets the domain from the the second element in the list.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the password from the specified session.
Get the password from the specified session. Session must be marked as "Allow show credentials" if not null is returned.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Password -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Password -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and gets the password from the the second element in the list.
Get the password from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Get the value of property given a session ID and path.
Protected values will always return null.
Non value types will always return ".ToString()".
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.
The path to the property being read (refernce RDM export xml). If top level property do not sepcify parameter or pass empty string [""] or $null
Property to read(get).

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Property -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Property -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and then returns MetaInformation.OS value of the the second element in the list.
Get the MetaInformation.OS value from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Get the Group value from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the list of available sessions.

Retrieve the list of available sessions for the current selected data source. Session list contains a column "Session" that can be directly manipulated then updated. (see SetRDMSessionCommand for more detail).
Copyright © 2006-2017

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Session -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Session -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions.
Retrieves the list of available sessions and displays the first item.
Retrieves the list of available sessions, modify the name of the second session, update the session.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the list of available templates.
Retrieve the list of available templates. The current selected template is marked with an "X".
Copyright © 2006-2017

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Template -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Template -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available templates and displays the first item.
Retrieves the list of available templates.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the username from the specified session.
Get the username from the specified session.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Username -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-RDM-Username -full".

Get the username from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new session instance.
Create a new session instance. The instance has not yet been saved. Assign the result to a variable then call "Set-RDM-Session $s" to save the session.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Session group.
New session host.
New session kind. Must be on of the following:

"AddOn", "Agent", "ApplicationTool", "Aws", "Azure", "AzureQueueStorage", "AzureStorage", "AzureTableStorage", "CitrixWeb", "CommandLine", "Computer", "Contact", "Credential", "Customer", "Dameware", "Database", "DataEntry", "DataReport", "Document", "DropBox", "Ftp", "Group", "Host", "HpRgs", "HyperV", "ICA", "IntelAMT", "InventoryReport", "LogMeIn", "NotUsed2", "PCAnywhere", "PowerShell", "Putty", "Radmin", "RDPConfigured", "RDPFilename", "RemoteAssistance", "S3", "ScreenConnect", "Script", "SessionTool", "Shortcut", "SNMPReport", "SkyDrive", "TeamViewer", "TemplateGroup", "Undefined", "VirtualBox", "VirtualPC", "VMRC", "VMWare", "VMWareConsole", "VNC", "VPN", "WebBrowser", "WindowsVirtualPC", "XenServer", "XWindow"
New session name.
Create session from template.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help New-RDM-Session -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help New-RDM-Session -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create & save new session.

maml:description.maml:para: Open the specified session.
Open the specified session.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Open-RDM-Session -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Open-RDM-Session -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and opens the second element in the list.

maml:description.maml:para: Delete an existing session.
You will be prompted to confirm the delete.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Forces removal of the session without confirmation by the user. Optional.
Specifies the ID of the session to be deleted from.
Do not send refresh notification back to Remote Desktop Manager.
This should be used when looping trough sessions (for optimization).

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDM-Session -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDM-Session -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Force delete of the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Retrieves the list of available sessions, deletes session at index 1.

maml:description.maml:para: Set current active data source.
Set current active data source.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the GUID of the data source to set as the current.
The value must be a valid GUID, in the form {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-DataSource -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-DataSource -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set active data source to the data source with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Retrieves the list of available data sources and sets the current data source the the second element in the list.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the domain from the specified session.
Set the domain from the specified session.
Copyright © 2006-2017
New domain name.
Specifies the ID of the session to get the domain from.
Do not send refresh notification back to Remote Desktop Manager.
This should be used when looping trough sessions (for optimization).

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-Domain -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-Domain -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the domain from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Retrieves the list of available sessions and sets the domain from the the second element in the list with no UI refresh.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the password from the specified session.
Set the password from the specified session. Session must be marked as "Allow show credentials" if not null is returned.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.
Do not send refresh notification back to Remote Desktop Manager.
This should be used when looping trough sessions (for optimization).
Password as SecurString.
Use either "Read-Host -AsSecureString" or "ConvertTo-SecureString"

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-Password -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-Password -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and sets the password from the the second element in the list.
Set the password from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Set the value of property given a session ID and path.
Protected values will always return null.
Non value types will always return ".ToString()".
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.
Do not send refresh notification back to Remote Desktop Manager.
This should be used when looping trough sessions (for optimization).
The path to the property being read (refernce RDM export xml). If top level property do not sepcify parameter or pass empty string [""] or $null.
Property to set.
New value.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-Property -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-Property -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 1-----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-RDM-Property -ID "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}" -Property "Group" -Value "My New Group Name"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the Group value from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Set the MetaInformation.OS value from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 3-----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $list = Get-RDMSession; Set-RDM-Property -ID $list[1].ID -Path "MetaInformation" -Property "OS" -Value "Windows Server 2008 R2"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and then sets the MetaInformation.OS value of the the second element in the list.

maml:description.maml:para: Save/set the session.
Save/set the session. Session must be first fetch via Session property of the Get-RDM-Session cmdlet or via the New-RDMSession result.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Do not send refresh notification back to Remote Desktop Manager.
This should be used when looping trough sessions (for optimization).
Session object, must be retrieved from Get-RDM-Session or created via New-RDMSession.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-Session -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDM-Session -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create & save new session.
Retrieves the list of available sessions, modify the name of the second session, update the session.

This should be used when looping trough sessions (for optimization).

maml:description.maml:para: Export RDM session to a file
Export RDM session to a file
Copyright © 2006-2017
File type for the export. Must be one of the following:
"CSV", "HTML", "XML", "RDM"
Include credentials in the export (Only available for the XML/RDM type).
Include Security Groups in the export (Only available for the XML/RDM type).
Set a password to protect the file.
Path where the file will be the saved. Must end with:
"CSV: .zip", "HTML: .html", "XML: .xml", "RDM: .rdm"
Sessions object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMSession or created via New-RDMSession.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Export-RDMSession -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Export-RDMSession -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $sessions = get-rdmsession; $password = read-host -assecurestring "Password"; Export-RDMSession -Path C:\MyPath\MyFilename.html -Sessions $sessions -ExportType "HTML" -Password $password

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and export them to a html file at C:\MyPath\Filename.html.

maml:description.maml:para: Import RDM session from a file
Import RDM session from a file
Copyright © 2006-2017
Action when a duplicate is found. Must be one of the following:
"Add", "Overwrite", "Ignore"
The group where the sessions will be saved.
Path where the file is loaded. Must be finish:
"RDM: .rdm", "XML: .xml"

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new datasource instance.
Create a new datasource instance. The instance has not yet been saved. Assign the result to a variable then call "Set-RDMDatasource $s" to save the datasource.
Copyright © 2006-2017
New datasource name.
New datasource type. Must be on of the following:
"XML", "SQLite", "SQLSERVER", "DROPBOX", "RDMO", "S3", "FTP", "ACCESS", "MYSQL", "RDMS", "SFTP", "WEBDAV", "WEB"
Note: To create a DODB data source you must use "RDMO" and to create a DVLS data source you must use "RDMS"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions, deletes role at index 1.

maml:description.maml:para: Delete an existing security group.
You will be prompted to confirm the delete.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Forces removal of the security group without confirmation by the user. Optional.
Specifies the GUID of the security group to be deleted from.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMSecurityGroup -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMSecurityGroup -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Force delete of the security group with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Retrieves the list of available security groups, deletes security group at index 1.

maml:description.maml:para: Delete an existing session.
You will be prompted to confirm the delete.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Forces removal of the session without confirmation by the user. Optional.
Specifies the ID of the session to be deleted.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMSession -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMSession -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions, deletes session at index 1.
Force delete of the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Delete an existing user.
You will be prompted to confirm the delete.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Forces removal of the user without confirmation by the user. Optional.
Specifies the GUID of the user to be deleted from.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMUser -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMUser -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available users, deletes user at index 1.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a role to an user.
Remove a role to an user.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Role object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMRole or created via New-RDMRole.
User object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMUser or created via New-RDMUser.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMRoleToUser -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMRoleToUser -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove role to an user.

maml:description.maml:para: Set current active data source.
Set current active data source.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the GUID of the data source to set as the current.
The value must be a valid GUID, in the form {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMCurrentDataSource -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMCurrentDataSource -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available data sources and sets the current data source the the second element in the list.
Set active data source to the data source with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Save/set the datasource.
Save/set the datasource. Datasource must be first fetch via Data source property of the Get-RDMDataSource cmdlet or via the New-RDMDataSource result.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the the data source to set/save.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMDataSource -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMDataSource -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Change the name of the first data source

maml:description.maml:para: Set the value of property given for a datasource.
Protected values will always return null.
Non value types will always return ".ToString()".
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the datasouce
Property to set.
New value.

Set username in personal credentials

maml:description.maml:para: Save/set the session.
Save/set the session. Session must be first fetch via Session property of the Get-RDM-Session cmdlet or via the New-RDMSession result.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.
Session object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMSession or created via New-RDMSession.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create & save new session.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the domain from the specified session.
Set the domain from the specified session.
Copyright © 2006-2017
New domain name.
Specifies the ID of the session to get the domain from.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionDomain -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionDomain -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the domain from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Retrieves the list of available sessions and sets the domain from the the second element in the list with UI refresh.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the password from the specified session.
Set the password from the specified session. Session must be marked as "Allow show credentials" if not null is returned.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.
Password as SecureString.
Use either "Read-Host -AsSecureString" or "ConvertTo-SecureString"

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionPassword -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionPassword -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the password from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Retrieves the list of available sessions and sets the password from the the second element in the list.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the value of property given a session ID and path.
Protected values will always return null.
Non value types will always return ".ToString()".
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.
The path to the property being read (reference RDM export xml). In the case of top level property do not specify parameter or pass empty string [""] or $null.
Property to set.
New value.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionProperty -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionProperty -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 1-----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-RDMSessionProperty -ID "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}" -Property "Group" -Value "My New Group Name"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the Group value from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 2-----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $list = Get-RDMSession; Set-RDMSessionProperty -ID $list[1].ID -Path "MetaInformation" -Property "OS" -Value "Windows Server 2008 R2"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and then sets the MetaInformation.OS value of the the second element in the list.
Set the MetaInformation.OS value from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Set the username on the specified session.
Set the username on the specified session.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Specifies the ID of the session to set the password from.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionUsername -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionUsername -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the username from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Retrieves the list of available sessions and gets the password from the the second element in the list.

maml:description.maml:para: Save/set the user.
Save/set the user. User must be first fetch via user property of the Get-RDMUser cmdlet or via the New-RDMUser result.
Copyright © 2006-2017
User object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMUser or created via New-RDMUser.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUser -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUser -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available users, modify the name of the second user, update the user.
Create & save new security group.

maml:description.maml:para: Assign/set user permissions.
Assign/set user permissions.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Allows the user to add entries in groups/folders for that security group.
Allows the user to Delete the entries for that security group.
Allows the user to Edit the entries for that security group.
Security group object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMSecurityGroup or created via New-RDMSecurityGroup.
User object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMUser or created via New-RDMUser.
Allows the user to View AND USE the entries for that security group.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserGroupRights -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserGroupRights -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available users and groups. Set permission add and delete to the second user of the list on the first group of the list

maml:description.maml:para: Set the value of property given to a user.
Set the value of property given to a user.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Property to set.
Specifies the GUID of the user to get the password from.
New value.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserProperty -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserProperty -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available users and then sets the description value of the the second element in the list.
Set the description value for the user given.

maml:description.maml:para: Assign/set user security settings.
Assign/set user security settings.
Copyright © 2006-2017
Allows the user to move the sessions using drag-and-drop from other applications.
Allows the user to use the Reveal Password command.
Allows the user to Export sessions.
Allows the user to Import sessions.
Allows the user to see the content of the Details tab for all sessions.
Allows the user to see the content of the Logs that apply to a session.
Allows the user to see the content of the Information tab for all sessions.
Do not send refresh notification back to Remote Desktop Manager.
This should be used when looping trough sessions.
Allows the user to enable the Offline Mode on the data sources. Choose between:
Disabled : no offline cache allowed for that user
ReadOnly : a read-only cache is allowed for Advanced Data Sources.
ReadWrite : an advanced cache, with change synchronization, is allowed for Advanced Data Sources.
User object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMUser or created via New-RDMUser.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserSecurity -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserSecurity -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set user to allow it to import, export, not allow to reveal password and set offline mode to read/write and

maml:description.maml:para: Update RDM user interface.
Update RDM user interface.
Copyright © 2006-2017

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Update-RDMUI -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Update-RDMUI -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update RDM user interface.
